meanings.definition: To coat with opsonins to facilitate phagocytosis by leukocytes.
meanings.sent1: The scientist opsonized the bacteria to help the immune cells attack them.
meanings.sent2: The doctor opsonized the pathogens before studying their effects on the body.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully opsonized the vegetables with a special sauce for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight opsonized the colors of the painting, making them more vibrant.
meanings.sent5: The rain opsonized the earth, bringing out the rich smell of the soil.

meanings.definition: Having been treated with opsonins to enhance phagocytosis.
meanings.sent1: The opsonized pathogens were quickly engulfed by the immune cells.
meanings.sent2: The opsonized cells showed increased susceptibility to immune attack.
meanings.sent3: The opsonized sandwich looked so delicious that everyone wanted a bite.
meanings.sent4: The opsonized book cover caught the eye of every reader in the library.
meanings.sent5: The opsonized fabric felt softer and smoother to the touch.

meanings.definition: The process of enhancing phagocytosis by coating with opsonins.
meanings.sent1: Opsonization is crucial for the immune system to fight off infections effectively.
meanings.sent2: The opsonization of pathogens helps the body recognize and eliminate them.
meanings.sent3: The opsonization of the cake with frosting made it look even more tempting.
meanings.sent4: Opsonization is like giving the immune cells a 'target' to aim for.
meanings.sent5: The opsonization of the seeds improved their chances of successful germination.
